brief_description: A comparison between large and small droplet flu vaccination
description: Evaluation of the parameters required for effective aerosol delivery of influenza virus in mice using controlled 20 and 30 m MMAD particle aerosols as proof of concept for LAIV aerosol delivery
endpoints: HAI, levels of IgA and IgG antibodies of lung homogenates
hypothesis: Demonstrating the feasibility of nasal vaccination using aerosolized particles
objectives: Demonstrating the feasibility of nasal vaccination using aerosolized particles
official_title: Aerosol vaccination induces robust protective immunity to homologous and heterologous influenza infection in mice

arm.description: mice were inoculated with 100 ul of live X31 influenza virus with 10*2(TCID50/ml) titer by intranasal delivery
arm.name: live X31 - intranasal

arm.description: mice were inoculated with live X31 influenza virus with 10*2(TCID50/ml) titer by mask aerosol delivery (20 micron droplets) for 15 sec and a flow rate of 1 cm*3/min
arm.name: live X31 -aerosol -20 M- 15 sec

arm.description: mice were inoculated with live X31 influenza virus with 10*2(TCID50/ml) titer by mask aerosol delivery (20 micron droplets) for 30 sec and a flow rate of 1 cm*3/min
arm.name: live X31 -aerosol -20 M- 30 sec

arm.description: mice were inoculated with live X31 influenza virus with 10*2(TCID50/ml) titer by mask aerosol delivery (20 micron droplets) for 45 sec and a flow rate of 1 cm*3/min
arm.name: live X31 -aerosol -20 M- 45 sec
